author: Staff Reporter
text:
dance and music:A cultural troupe will visit various parts of Vellore to create awareness on child labour.- Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

A cultural troupe is travelling to various parts of the district to create awareness on child labour among public.

Flagged off on Monday, the cultural campaign will visit places in Pernambut, Gudiyatham, Ambur, Vaniyambadi, Tirupattur, Vellore, Panapakkam, Sholinghur, Walaja and Arakkonam. Saaral – a cultural troupe – will create awareness among the public in these areas by way of performances.

“They will create awareness among public on the ills of child labour system through cultural performances. They will tell the public that children below 14 years cannot be employed, and such practices will draw legal action including penalty and also imprisonment,” M. Rajapandian, project director, Child Labour Project, Vellore said.

The district administration has cautioned the public and various firms from employing children in houses, hotels, lodges, tea shops and roadside eateries.

Violations could attract fine of up to Rs. 20,000 and imprisonment as per the provisions of the Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act, 1986.

In Vellore district, officials have been conducting surprise checks on child labourers. So far, officials have rescued 1,069 child labourers in the district. They have been admitted to the 43 Child Labour Special Training Centres in the district for the purpose of education. Collector R. Nanthagopal flagged off the cultural campaign.
title: Creating awareness on child labour
